lacewing.description: Lacewings are beneficial insects that prey on aphids and other pests.
lacewing.suggestion: Encourage lacewings in your field for natural pest control.
key_points: Eggs are laid on foliage and hatch in 4-5 days.
Larvae are voracious predators of soft-bodied insects.
Adults are attracted to light and are harmless to plants.
lacewing.habitat: Found in gardens, fields, and forests.

ladybug_dy.description: Ladybug (DY) is a common predator of aphids and scale insects.
ladybug_dy.suggestion: Ladybugs are helpful; avoid using broad-spectrum insecticides.
key_points: Both larvae and adults feed on pests.
Bright red color with black spots.
Can consume up to 5,000 aphids in a lifetime.

ladybug_lbq.description: Ladybug (LBQ) is known for its voracious appetite for pests.
ladybug_lbq.suggestion: Protect ladybugs to maintain pest control.
key_points: Can be orange, yellow, or red with variable spots.
Effective against aphids and scale insects.

ladybug_hb.description: Ladybug (HB) is a beneficial insect in crop fields.
ladybug_hb.suggestion: Support ladybug populations for healthy crops.
key_points: Feeds on aphids and small insects.

stinkbug_mx.description: Stinkbug (MX) can be a pest in vegetable crops.
stinkbug_mx.suggestion: Monitor stinkbug populations and use targeted control if needed.
key_points: Feeds on plant sap, causing damage.

stinkbug_mc.description: Stinkbug (MC) feeds on plant juices and can damage crops.
stinkbug_mc.suggestion: Use pheromone traps for stinkbug management.

stinkbug_lv.description: Stinkbug (LV) is a minor pest in some regions.

stinkbug_hsy.description: Stinkbug (HSY) is an invasive species causing crop losses.
stinkbug_hsy.suggestion: Remove weeds and debris to reduce stinkbug habitat.
key_points: Brown color with white bands on antennae.
Feeds on fruits, vegetables, and ornamentals.
Highly invasive and difficult to control.
stinkbug_hsy.habitat: Wide range of habitats including homes.

stinkbug_ccc.description: Stinkbug (CCC) can affect fruit and vegetable quality.
stinkbug_ccc.suggestion: Use row covers to protect crops.
key_points: Feeds on a variety of crops.

stinkbug_zh.description: Stinkbug (ZH) is less common but can be found in some fields.
key_points: Feeds on small insects and plants.

syrphid.description: Syrphid flies are pollinators and their larvae eat aphids.
syrphid.suggestion: Encourage syrphid flies for pollination and pest control.

bee.description: Bees are essential pollinators for many crops.
bee.suggestion: Protect bees by minimizing pesticide use during bloom.
key_points: Live in colonies with a queen.

bollworm.description: Bollworm is a major pest of cotton and other crops.
bollworm.suggestion: Use integrated pest management (IPM) strategies for bollworm control.
key_points: Larvae feed on cotton bolls and other crops.
bollworm.habitat: Cotton fields and other crop areas.
